poem:
The Alchemy of Flavor  

A splash of oil, glistening,   
like morning dew on leaves;  
vinegar's sharp kiss,  
a whisper of zest—  
tang and silk entwine  
in the alchemy of kitchen dance.  
Ordinary becomes feast,  
weekday into celebration,  
a quiet magic in each drop,  
awakening the slumbering day.
